document_data.mainbody: The '''church of Semuanya''' ({{Pronounce|se|moo|ÆN|ya|refs={{Cite dragon/93/Ay pronunseeAYshun gyd|28}}}}) was the primary religious organization dedicated to the worship and service of the [[lizardfolk]] [[god]] [[Semuanya]], The Survivor.There is no known proper name for the overall body of clergy dedicated to Semuanya, nor is there a unified formal organization. Instead, the term "church of Semuanya" is adopted for discussion and wiki purposes.

Dogma.Attitudes:
The seemingly simplistic societies of most lizardfolk reflected their deep-rooted faith in Semuanya, who they took great pride in and whose mythology led most to condemn intelligence (if not cunning or tactical acumen) as a pointless and wasteful trait that led to overthinking and cultural corruption. They adopted the view of Semuanya, that life was meant to be lived, and that the most important parts were hunting, fighting and breeding.

There were known exceptions to this philosophy, such as the existence of the occasional sterile, hermaphroditic lizardfolk with unusually complex brains and greater innate intelligence. Members of this uncommon breed were revered as beings touched by Semuanya's divinity, closer in being to Semuanya's sundered mate Kecuala. Despite usually becoming [[shaman]]s and advisors, these lizardfolk rarely rose to true positions of power, could not breed, and even if they could were seen as undesirable by female lizardfolk due to their higher intelligence, and so their influence was rarely enough to truly advance their people.

Despite their general anti-intellectualism, lizardmen that worshiped Semuanya were among the civilized groups of their kind{{Cite dragon/141/Orcs Throw Spells, Too!|30}} that defied the popular view of their people as savage beasts. They did not consider [[human]]s and [[demihuman]]s to be targets for hunting, and generally released any such captives, or failing that put them up for ransom.

document_data.Activities:
Semuanya's shamans and [[witch doctor]]s, often the leaders of their tribes, were the general care-givers of those tribes, particularly in the fields of healing and medicine, They emulated the god's taciturn ways and usually counseled avoidance of [[humanoid]] races and isolation in general for their people.

Though the shamans were not given tests, they were required to sacrifice a tenth of the tribe's hunting trophies,  and worshipers as a whole were instructed to serve where needed, frequently in the form of Semuanya tasking them to recover a tribe's lost eggs or aid other warbands. Shamans of the older generation would teach those of the next.

Organization.Classes: What true [[cleric]]s Semuanya possessed functioned as shamans regardless. The deity's close connection to nature made it easy for lizardfolk who grew up worshiping Semuanya to worship nature itself, and so there were a great number of lizardfolk druids.

document_data.Rituals:
Lizardfolk shamans oversaw the rites and ceremonies that honored Semuanya, which generally took the form of breeding and battling as benefitted the tribes. Clerics of the Survivor did not hold regular services, although hunting prizes were sacrificed on the full moon monthly.

In times of peace, prayers to Semuanya took the form of long chants and epic songs intoned in [[Draconic language|Draconic]], while in times of war these were shortened to hisses and reptilian barks before battle. Should the lizardfolk prevail in battle, captives became the centerpieces of great rites involving dancing, storytelling, and ritual combat which ended with them either being consumed or sacrificed to Semuanya.

Base of Operations.Regions: Semuanya was a favored deity to the lizardfolk of [[Surkh]], and lizardfolk worshipers of theirs existed {{SI|4|mi|k}} inland on the [[Chult]]an peninsula. as did the [[stingtail]]s and [[asabi]]s of [[Isstosseffifil]]. Free asabi in [[Anauroch]] commonly did likewise after they met a lizardfolk [[cleric]] of Semuanya and adopted the faith.
Base of Operations.Shrines & Temples:
There were no true shrines or sacred places of Semuanya;{{cite web/Ill Met on the River of Dreams/The Grove of Shrieking Idols}} or palisades carved with pictographic symbols of the deity.

The lizardfolk of Chult's inland believed that the water from their wells were holy sites of Semuanya, not too holy to use, but holy enough that proper homage had to be paid before drawing it in the form of whispering prayers. Notably, the waters of the wells were actually holy, although despite their beliefs to the contrary, the regular sacrifices the lizardfolk performed using them were irrelevant to the purity of the water.

The lizardfolk clerics of Semuanya around the [[Spines of Surkh]] erected wards around the local crypts, but were so lax that many scaled [[undead]] rose around the region.

Possessions.Weapons:
Semuanya's favored weapon for his followers was the [[club]]. A lizardfolk cleric who cast ''[[weapon of the deity]]'' would receive a ''+1 [[screaming]] club''.

The lizardfolk of the [[Vast Swamp]] brewed a potent [[Sacred lizardfolk poison|paralytic poison]] they said was sacred to Semuanya and not to be shared with outsiders.

document_data.Relationships:
Semuanya's shamans were opposed by those of the powerful [[tanar'ri lord]] [[Sess'innek]], all of which attempted to slay them on sight.
The demon had made substantial progress in corrupting the lizardfolk, his honeyed words promising strength intoxicating to many of the simple race, who saw only weakness in the old ways of Semuanya's shamans. In Surkh, Semuanya's faith was also endangered by the [[Cult of Tiamat]], who secretly awaited the day they could challenge the primacy of the church of Semuanya.
